column13: Good food, would recommend but if you have been there once you probably wouldn't be eagerly awaiting a second visit
See letter printed in the Winston Salem Journal many months ago.

column4: 1 Lodge Street Biltmore Estate Asheville, NC  28803
column13: One trip and you are hooked!!! From the homemade bread to the crisp salads, gourmet entrees and magnificent desserts....it is difficult to decide which entree is best....over the week, I had the delicious tender veal, poached salmon, grouper and risotto all accompanied by fall vegetables. A culinary delight!!!! And service to match....a perfect evening meal to accompany a wonderful fall get-away.
Once again, this restaurant did not disappoint. Especailly good wines this visit. The menu change is nice.
Just outstanding. Poultry raised locally. Poulet rouge and game hen are remarkable. Highly recommend in every way.
Nice relaxing restaurant/bar. Food was good and reasonably priced, service was very good. Will certainly go back one of the better places for the price in town.

column1: Blue Ridge Dining Room - Grove Park Inn
column13: The food was delicious and there was plenty of it. The service was great and all thought that our server was "johnnie on the spot". I would recommend the Blue Ridge Dinning Room to all my friends.ART MURRAY
Ambiance great, service great, food avg. for price.

We go to Casa Rustica every year for our anniversary. We love Italian food, and love going to Casa Rustica. The food is great, the atmosphere is great, and the service has always been good. We highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who is visiting the Boone, North Carolina, area.

We ended up with a party of 9. Food was good, and our waiter was GREAT!. HOWEVER, one of my friends and I asked if we could have a little more of the sauce that was on our filets and the chef said that he would have to charge us $1 because it was made with red wine!!! Really?! I am paying $29 for my entree and you are going to charge me for a little more sauce?! Probably won't return because of that. Chef needs a little lesson about how to please his customers.

The restaurant is small but there were 4 large parties and it was extremely noisy and only 2 waiters. We were sitted before 2 of the larger parties and order immediately. Our waiter got very busy and seemed overwhelmed. Food took a long time but I had the Hanger steak recommended by the waiter and it was delicious. My husband had the specila.. Mahi and the sauce on the plate was so much it overwhelmed the dish and he was disappointed. Seems like needed more help.
The booth was a bit uncomfortable and the service was a uneven. It would have been more romantic if they had lowered the lighting.

Tried this cozy little neighborhood restaurant due to the reviews on Open Table when we were visiting Asheville. NC. The best meal we had all week and wish we had found it sooner because we would most definitely gone again. Our waiter was wonderful and the food amazing.
Always fantastic food and warm, friendly service. Fine dining with a family feel. Crippens is a "must" when you visit Blowing Rock.

This was our 2nd time at C 24 and not our last. We had a reservation which was a good thing, it was a Saturday night and they were busy. All 3 of us found multiple items on the menu that we were drawn to. Our server was kind,knowledgeable but did not offer to help translate the menu. The food arrived at a nice pace and we never felt rushed, service did not hover but was always close by. Our salads and soup were fresh and evoked very positive reactions. 2 of us shared an entree and our server offered to split the dish on two plates which was appreciated. Again our entrees were very good, all plates went back to the kitchen empty. Dessert was delicious. Overall it was a very good experience, one that we were still commenting on the next day.

WAS PLEASANTLY SURPRISED WITH TAPAS SELECTIONS. ARRIVED EARLY (BEFORE RES.), SAT AT THE BAR AND WATCHED FOOD PREPARATION WHICH WAS A LOT OF FUN. AFTER SEEING CERTAIN ONES PLATED UP WE CHANGED OUR MINDS FOR PREVIOUSLY SELECTED ITEMS FROM MENU ON LINE. OUR SERVICE WAS VERY GOOD, WAITER REALLY HELPED WITH WINE SELECTION AND OUR DINING EXPERIENCE WAS VERY GOOD......WE'RE PICKY PEOPLE TO PLEASE. ENJOYED THE AMBIANCE AND ENERGY IN THE RESTAURANT AS WELL !!! WOULD DEFINITELY GO BACK.

Food was good but not outstanding. Both my husband and I were a little disappointed. Something was missing but we couldn't quite put our finger on what. I rated the ambiance only good because we were far, far away from the buffet and had to wind around many tables and chairs to get to it. Also, we were placed next to a wall of windows where it was really chilly. I had to leave my jacket on the entire time.

column4: Lodge Street Biltmore Estate Asheville, NC  28803
column13: This was a special treat, we had a great time, impeccable service and the food was memorable.

This place is great for groups. Food is typically American and there is lots to choose from off the menu. We've been several times and our meals have always been good. They cater for children which is a plus and also give crayons and a sheet to color on.
The Gamkeeper was very nice. Great ambiance and the food was excellent. Would def. recommend to anybody in the area for dinner.

We had a large group and they did a great job of accommodating us. The food was really good and there was a wide range of options without being overwhelming. It was a nice quaint place that is easy to walk to from the Grove Park Inn. Definitely worth going to and avoiding the drive to downtown.
18% gratuity was added to our check in a very nonconspicous way. The waiter should have reminded us that it was added.

Our favorite restaurant in Banner Elk to dine. The food choices and quality are excellent and the service is consistently outstanding. We had 7:30 reservations on a very busy Friday nite and were seated immediately upon arriving. Excellent wine choices and very knowledgable staff to help you select the perfect wine.

Great romantic dinner location. We were able to sit at a window table that overlooked Main Street. Extensive wine list and many wines by the glass made for an interesting evening. Ordered the salmon, duck breast, and the scallop appetizer. Service was excellent as was the entrees.
Excellent food! Great service, may return before leaving town. Chef came out to check on table, very personable. Will definitely dine here again when visiting Asheville!

Lovely spot in Waynesville for dinner. This was our second visit and we will return. Service is attentive but not intrusive. Food is well prepared and well presented. While their wine list is limited their corkage fee allows those that have a favorite bottle to enjoy it at their table.

column1: Olive or Twist Restaurant and Bar
column13: The band was fun and energetic! There was ballroom dancing happening.
Lovely setting on the water and a very interesting menu with great daily specials. Bar is warm and cozy and the wine list is very nice. If you're in the area you should definitely try it.

I am an out of towner foodie. Found Pomodoro's last visit and will not fail to return anytime in Asheville.Really outstanding Greek and Italian dishes. Hearty servings.Met the owner this time.Traveling w Italian friend. Her quote "best pizza I've ever had".
Consistently one of the best in Asheville.

column1: Red Stag Grill-Grand Bohemian Hotel Asheville
column13: went there 11/3/2012 for my 5 yr anniversary. the food was amazing, my wife had the tasting menu, i had never tried duck, but it was great! I had the steak with mac n cheese, best i ever had! Thank you for your service!

Rezaz is one of my favorite restaurants in Asheville. It is consistently wonderful and so when I have folks visiting I always come to Rezaz. We had friends down from Boston and they were so pleased. I can tell you that everyone cleaned the plates...thoroughly!

My husband, mother and I had dinner at Roux one evening. The wait person was very courteous and professional, and the food was quite good. This is one of the better restaurants located in Biltmore Park. We definitely will visit Roux again.

column1: Rowland's Restaurant at Westglow Resort and Spa
column13: incredibly romantic and scenic view
A very lovely and delicious dining experience!

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Harrah's Cherokee Casino & Hotel
column13: Our waiter and his assistant were great!!! Food was absolutely fabulous!!!!!! The only thing we did not enjoy was that the restaurant did not adhere to their dress code. Many of the customers were in blue jeans or jogging pants along with flip flops and tennis shoes.

column4: 86 Lily Pad Lane Flat Rock, NC  28731-8576
column13: We enjoyed a lovely Brunch with you. I was very happy to see that you were kid-friendly. We have a 7 year old and she thought the whole exprience was fantastic! Our food was just wonderful and the staff well we could not have ask for any better. Thank you

Thoroughly enjoyed our first visit here. Food was beautiful fresh and unique. Atmosphere was wonderful and inviting. Have already recommended to others and will definitely return. Be sure to make reservation because it is impossible to get in without one in the tourist season!

column4: 125 S Lexington Ave Suite 103 Asheville, NC  28801
column13: I am a chef at a B&B and a group of guests went to Storm and raved about it. After reading the menu I knew I had to check it out because I am a definite foodie. A best friend of mine and I went on a date and it was wonderful! My husband and I will definitely come to celebrate occasions or even a romantic date. I will be back!!! Btw check out their cocktails...yum!
The food is excellent. It is a little pricey however. Great reception staff.

Hawaiian sunfish entree which our server recommended was excellent, as was the baby suckling pig entree. Only slight disappointment were the raw beets in the appetizer which lacked the flavor which cooked beets would have had. Muscadine mousse for dessert was wonderful. All in all, an outstanding meal.
This place in gorgeous and the atmosphere is awesome. Next time I will make a reservation in the main dining room but we got seated in a side room right beside the fireplace and it was awesome!!!
We were greeted warmly by host but after that, our server essentially ignored us .We had to ask to have a drink order taken after a long wait then had to ask for the wine list. The food was average.

Was a great evening. Annalise was very knowledgable about the wine and made a great recommendation. Crab cakes and pecan crusted shrimp were great , the salmon and the sausage plate were also enjoyed. Someone in our party loved the chocolate mousse.

Zambra exceeded my expectations. Everything we tried was interesting, with some creative taste combinations. Prices were reasonable, and servings were surprisingly large for a tapas restaurant. The atmosphere hasn't changed since we were there -- still dark and cave-like but not uninviting. Zambra isn't quite up to CÃºrate in terms of atmosphere or food, in my opinion, but it's a reasonable alternative when CÃºrate is fully booked, as it often is. I made reservations through Open Table but, on the negative side, there are zero Open Table points for eating here

column4: 502 West Main St. Banner Elk, NC  28604
column13: We have been here before but this time they were out of a lot of the items.
